confession.seduction_context: Husband had been angry with her about some money she had spent and beaten her. She went to woods in a rage and was met by Mre. Persin - resisted at first but succumbed three days later to his 'propos amielez' (sweet words)
sabbat_activities: dancing to music made by menestriers such as flute

witnesses.name: Nicolas Charier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: community member who had confrontation with her son

testimony.quarrel_subject: Fight between accused's son Demenge and Jean Gelliat; witness tried to separate them and had to defend himself against Demenge
testimony.threat_quote: et qu'elle l'auroit, ou le diable l'auroit

witnesses.name: Didier Daulphin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: had various disputes with her husband over years (both were manouvriers)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Various disputes with her husband over years

witnesses.name: Le maire Demenge Guenare
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: son-in-law of maire Thoussaint, in whose house accused regularly visited

testimony.quarrel_subject: She had said 'que s'ils ne faisoient tant d'estat de leurs enfans a les cherir qu'ilz timeroyent'; also hatred from when he was member of justice when she was accused by Georgeatte wife of Demenge Chopat
testimony.threat_quote: que le grand diable puisse emporter le mre., les serviteurs et chevaulx

witnesses.name: Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: mother of Odille who had dispute with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Dispute at mill about who should go first

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after accused passed near mare and foal

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme a Rocq Gerardin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: rejected marriage proposal from accused's son

testimony.quarrel_subject: Rejected marriage proposal from accused's son; accused said if she had married her son 'qu'elle n'eust heu tant de mal qu'elle avoit avec sondit marit, et qu'elle auroit encore jusques a Pasques'
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle n'eust heu tant de mal qu'elle avoit avec sondit marit, et qu'elle auroit encore jusques a Pasques

witnesses.name: Jean Daulphin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: community member who refused to sell milk and butter to accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused came repeatedly asking to buy milk and butter; refused first two times, accused became angry
Quarrel between his late wife and accused over who should go first at mill
Dispute with accused's husband about tithe 3 years before when witness held ferme
testimony.threat_quote: que peut estre Dieu ne luy feroit la grace de les lever une autre fois

testimony.quarrel_subject: Son Colas and accused's husband had been overpaid for work by mistake; son returned money rather than sharing it. Accused called him thief and threatened 'she or the Devil would have him'
testimony.threat_quote: she or the Devil would have him

witnesses.name: Mongin Forney
witnesses.occupation: maitre valet in 'marchandise des toiles' of George de la Roche
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: business rival (witness was in cloth trade competing with accused's husband and son)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused was angry and envious because they were taking trade from her husband and son
Accused made comment about witness's cow: 'vous avez une diable de vache, sy elle vouloit remplir ladite cassatte'; witness was affronted

testimony.threat_quote: if she were a witch she would kill him

timeline.subject: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders arrest and imprisonment

timeline.subject: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
timeline.details: First interrogation; accused denied all charges

timeline.subject: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses on same day, with no real results

timeline.subject: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed after thumbscrews, rack, and tordillons

timeline.subject: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions; thanked judges 'for the pain they took around her to ensure the salvation of her soul'

timeline.subject: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from Change de Nancy

accomplices_named.name: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boenfs
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat; recognised by her clothing although she had been masked like the others

prior_accusations.context: Accused Georgeatte Malley of being a witch and claimed to have seen her at the sabbat; accusation made before Chopat's wife's execution 5 years earlier (c. 1610)

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley to Nicolas Charier
notable_quotes.context: After Nicolas Charier defended himself against her son in a fight

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley to Nicolas Charier
notable_quotes.french: et qu'elle l'auroit, ou le diable l'auroit
notable_quotes.english: and that she would have him, or the devil would have him
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Nicolas Charier after he struck her son

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudon Charier to Georgeatte
notable_quotes.french: ils mecteroient leurs biens pour en voire une fin
notable_quotes.english: they would put their goods to see an end to it
notable_quotes.context: Threatened accused during his brother Nicolas's illness, demanding she remove it

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
notable_quotes.french: que s'ils ne faisoient tant d'estat de leurs enfans a les cherir qu'ilz timeroyent
notable_quotes.english: that if they did not make so much of their children to cherish them they would fear
notable_quotes.context: Said to maire Thoussaint about his children

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley
notable_quotes.french: que le grand diable puisse emporter le mre., les serviteurs et chevaulx
notable_quotes.english: that the great devil might carry off the mayor, the servants and horses
notable_quotes.context: Malediction called out to Demenge Guenare's servants taking horses past her house

notable_quotes.speaker: devin of Tanviller to Colas Tiriat
notable_quotes.french: que seroit bien daventure avant qu'il soit retourne en sa maison s'il ne rencontroit celle que luy avoit donne le mal
notable_quotes.english: that it would be good fortune before he returned to his house if he did not meet the one who had given the illness
notable_quotes.context: Diviner's prophecy about meeting the witch on way back

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley to Claudatte
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle n'eust heu tant de mal qu'elle avoit avec sondit marit, et qu'elle auroit encore jusques a Pasques
notable_quotes.english: that she would not have had so much trouble as she had with her husband, and that she would have more until Easter
notable_quotes.context: Threat to Claudatte after she rejected accused's son in marriage

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley to Jehenne
notable_quotes.french: vous avez une diable de vache, sy elle vouloit remplir ladite cassatte
notable_quotes.english: you have a devil of a cow, if she wanted to fill the said pot

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley to Demenge Vatrin
notable_quotes.french: que peut estre Dieu ne luy feroit la grace de les lever une autre fois
notable_quotes.english: that perhaps God would not grant him the grace to collect them another time

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley during interrogation
notable_quotes.french: une meschante femme et qu il y avoit longtemps qu'elle avoit dit qu'elle luy garderoit ung desplaisir
notable_quotes.english: a wicked woman and that it had been a long time since she said she would keep a grievance against her
notable_quotes.context: Describing Demenge Chopat's wife who had accused her

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley about Demenge Ganaire
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle prie Dieu de le paier de dire telz propos et qu'il luy veuille donner patience et que c'est ung Judas et trahistre
notable_quotes.english: that she prays God to make him pay for saying such things and that he wishes to give her patience and that he is a Judas and traitor
notable_quotes.context: Response when asked if she killed Demenge Ganaire's horses

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley protesting innocence
notable_quotes.french: que jamais elle ne puisse aller en Paradis sy elle ne confesse la verité, et qu'on la vouldroit faire dampner
notable_quotes.english: that may she never go to Paradise if she does not confess the truth, and that they would make her damned

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley under torture
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit aultant mieulx estre bruslée, que de recevoir ces tourmentz
notable_quotes.english: that she would much rather be burned than receive these torments

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley describing sabbat
notable_quotes.french: n'estoit des plus avant par ce que les pauvres estoyent tousjours mis en bas, et les riches en hault, et lors qu'il failloit retourner il convenoit aller baiser une paix, que l'un desdits diables tenoit en signe de reverence
notable_quotes.english: was not among the most forward because the poor were always put at the bottom and the rich at the top, and when it was time to return it was necessary to go kiss a paix that one of the said devils held as a sign of reverence

notable_quotes.speaker: Georgeatte femme de Didier Malley to judges
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle nous remercie de la peine que prenons a l'entour d'elle pour faire le salut de son ame
notable_quotes.english: that she thanks us for the pain we take around her to ensure the salvation of her soul

relationships.evidence_text: married for 23 years to Didier Malley, manouvrier
daughter of Demenge Tabourin and his wife Dedie
Georgeatte's son Demenge had got into fight
During illness his brother Claudon told her
Had had various disputes with her husband over years (both were manouvriers)
house of his father-in-law, maire Thoussaint
the late Clemence, wife of the maire Bastien

relationships.person1: Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs
relationships.evidence_text: Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs

relationships.person1: Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs

relationships.evidence_text: when she was in service with Demenge Colin
maitre valet in 'marchandise des toiles' of George de la Roche
her daughter Odille had been in service with maire Bastien

economic_context.details: Accused's husband and son were in cloth trade ('marchandise des toiles'); witness Mongin Forney testified that accused was angry and envious because his employer George de la Roche was taking trade from her husband and son. Multiple witnesses were manouvriers like accused's husband, suggesting a poor laboring class community. Dispute over tithe payment with Demenge Vatrin. Didier Daulphin reduced to poverty after being struck by accused, living from alms and unable to work. Accused's confession describes sabbat social hierarchy: 'the poor were always put at the bottom and the rich at the top.'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Suddenly taken ill, losing use of arms and legs, lasted a month, some expected him to die
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Fight between accused's son Demenge and Jean Gelliat; witness tried to separate them and defended himself against Demenge; accused came up to him furiously in street

harms_catalog.harm_description: Shoulder and all left side of body virtually paralysed, unable to work, reduced to great poverty, living from alms
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Various disputes with her husband over years; she struck him on the shoulder outside church without explanation

harms_catalog.harm_description: Aged 2, fell ill, dying a week later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She had said about their children 'que s'ils ne faisoient tant d'estat de leurs enfans a les cherir qu'ilz timeroyent'
As servants were taking horses past her house, she called out maledictions including 'que le grand diable puisse emporter le mre., les serviteurs et chevaulx'

harms_catalog.victim_name: Odille (daughter of Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs)
harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness lasted 15 months, losing use of limbs; became worse after drinking soup made from milk given by accused, then slowly recovered; now married in Allemagne
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Dispute at mill about who should go first
harms_catalog.method_alleged: milk/food (soup made from milk accused gave to witness's children)

harms_catalog.victim_name: Mare of Cl? femme de Noel Gerard
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after accused passed near mare and foal

harms_catalog.harm_description: Great sickness lasting 3 months or more, sometimes lost speech and all feeling in body, could not give suck to baby, all remedies seemed useless but finally recovered
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Rejected marriage proposal from accused's son; accused met her at fountain and said if she had married her son 'qu'elle n'eust heu tant de mal qu'elle avoit avec sondit marit, et qu'elle auroit encore jusques a Pasques'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill, dying next day as if rabid
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused came repeatedly asking to buy milk and butter; was refused first two times and became angry

harms_catalog.harm_description: Continual fever lasting 9 months, no remedies could help; was cured when accused brought her a plate of 'milletz'
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over who should go first at mill
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft; cured by food (milletz) brought by accused containing healing powder

harms_catalog.harm_description: Ill for 7 weeks, with no mark on body, but as if in despair and troubled in his mind
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Colas and accused's husband had been overpaid for work by mistake; Colas returned money rather than sharing it. Accused called him thief and threatened 'she or the Devil would have him'

harms_catalog.harm_description: One of 'commieres' struck him behind leg, hurt himself falling, needed a month's expensive treatment by surgeon
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused was angry and envious because witness's employer was taking cloth trade from her husband and son

harms_catalog.victim_name: Cow of Jehenne femme a Didier Rondel
harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow which had been giving lot of milk gave less every day; calves died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused said 'vous avez une diable de vache, sy elle vouloit remplir ladite cassatte'; witness was affronted
Various quarrels; accused threatened him saying if she were a witch she would kill him
Goats were always eating crop at edge of field
harms_catalog.method_alleged: powder sprinkled at edge of field

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Horse had done damage outside house
Cow had bumped into accused's cow

material_culture.context: Accused brought plate of milletz to cure Jean Mourenat's wife of fever; contained healing powder
Accused gave milk to children of Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs; also repeatedly asked to buy milk from Jean Daulphin
Accused repeatedly asked to buy butter from Jean Daulphin
Jehenne femme a Didier Rondel was returning from market at Raon with earthenware pot
Accused confessed to receiving powder from devil for causing harm and healing
Mongin Forney was putting commieres in water by bridge when one struck him behind leg
Mongin Forney was maitre valet in 'marchandise des toiles' of George de la Roche, competing with accused's husband and son in cloth trade
Woman with scarf on head seen in field jumping and throwing herself to ground
Music at sabbat made by menestriers, such as a flute
At sabbat, had to kiss a paix held by one of the devils as sign of reverence
Value of one of Demenge Guenare's horses that died
Demenge Colin and his wife accused Georgeatte of causing loss of more than 100 ecus

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; residence of accused and all witnesses
Jehenne femme a Didier Rondel was returning from market at Raon
Location of the devin (diviner) consulted by Colas Tiriat
Where Odille (daughter of Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs) was married after recovery
Colas Tiriat met Georgeatte on bridge on way back from consulting devin; Mongin Forney was putting commieres in water by bridge
Didier Daulphin was struck outside church by Georgeatte; Claudatte femme a Rocq Gerardin was at church when stricken with sickness on Chandelleur
Multiple quarrels over who should go first at mill (witnesses 11, 19, 14)
Accused went to woods in rage after husband beat her; met Mre. Persin there who seduced her
Georgeatte met Claudatte femme a Rocq Gerardin at fountain after her marriage
Dieudonne fils de Noel Gerard saw woman with scarf jumping and throwing herself to ground, with large black man watching from other side; powder sprinkled at edge of field
Accused attended sabbat 2-3 times per year, carried through air by master; 30-40 people there

weather_events: hailstorm to destroy millets (confessed to helping make at sabbat 5 years before)
economic_hardship_indicators: Didier Daulphin reduced to great poverty after paralysis, living from alms
Both accused's husband and Didier Daulphin were manouvriers (day laborers)
Accused claimed at sabbat 'the poor were always put at the bottom and the rich at the top'
Dispute over who should go first at mill (suggesting scarcity/competition)
Jean Mourenat's wife had no bread after losing place at mill
Business competition in cloth trade between accused's family and George de la Roche
religious_calendar_references: Chandelleur (Candlemas) - when Claudatte femme a Rocq Gerardin was stricken at church
Pasques (Easter) - mentioned in threat to Claudatte

legal_context.redress_outcome: Admitted to being called witch by several, but generally had no witnesses; claimed Demenge Ganaire was a drunkard and she lacked means to take him to court

hearsay_chains.content: Told him he would meet the one who gave the illness on way back; met Georgeatte on bridge
Heard Colas Charier's wife accuse Georgeatte of causing his strange illness
Had several times heard Demenge Colin call her witch
Heard Demenge Colin and his wife call her witch and accuse her of causing loss of more than 100 ecus

hearsay_chains.source: her youngest son and Lucas Brandec
hearsay_chains.content: Had heard her called witch by her youngest son and by Lucas Brandec

hearsay_chains.reporter: Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs
hearsay_chains.content: Georgeatte told witness that Pieron had said there was another such household in la Neufville
He had heard that she had said about their children 'que s'ils ne faisoient tant d'estat de leurs enfans a les cherir qu'ilz timeroyent'
As doyen had heard accusation by wife of Demenge Chopat before her execution 5 years earlier
Reputation five years, since accusation by Demenge Chopat's wife

emotional_state_notes: Went to woods 'in a rage' after husband beat her
Said she would rather be burned than receive torments of torture
Thanked judges for ensuring salvation of her soul after confessing

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Called Demenge Ganaire 'ung Judas et trahistre' (a Judas and traitor); said he hated her because every time he passed house he talked of need to burn witches; called him a drunkard
Said Demenge Chopat's wife was 'une meschante femme' (a wicked woman) and that it had been a long time since she said she would keep a grievance against accused
Generally said she had been called witch by several but had no witnesses; lacked means to take Ganaire to court

third_parties.name: Demenge (son of Georgeatte)
third_parties.context: Got into fight with Jean Gelliat; witness Nicolas Charier tried to separate them and had to defend himself against Demenge. Also sought to marry Claudatte femme a Rocq Gerardin but was rejected. Involved in cloth trade with father, competing with George de la Roche

third_parties.name: youngest son of Georgeatte
third_parties.context: Had called his mother witch according to witness Estienne Pescheur

third_parties.name: Jean Gelliat
third_parties.context: Got into fight with Georgeatte's son Demenge

third_parties.name: maire Thoussaint
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: accused and her husband regularly in his house
third_parties.context: Accused and her husband were regularly in house of maire Thoussaint, father-in-law of witness Demenge Guenare

third_parties.name: Adam (son of Demenge Guenare)
third_parties.context: Aged 2, fell ill and died a week later after accused made threatening comment about children

third_parties.name: Clemence wife of maire Bastien
third_parties.context: Was very ill; her children asked Colas Tiriat to consult devin of Tanviller; now deceased

third_parties.name: devin of Tanviller
third_parties.context: Diviner consulted by Colas Tiriat; told him he would meet the one who gave the illness on way back

third_parties.name: Georgeatte wife of Demenge Chopat
third_parties.context: Executed 5 years before trial; had accused Georgeatte Malley as witch and claimed to have seen her at sabbat; seen at sabbat in accused's confession

third_parties.name: Demenge Colin
third_parties.context: Had several times called her witch; accused her of causing loss of more than 100 ecus; Claudatte femme a Rocq Gerardin was in his service

third_parties.name: Lucas Brandec
third_parties.context: Had called Georgeatte witch; she sought no redress from him

third_parties.name: Odille (daughter of Nicolle femme a Jean des Boeufs)
third_parties.context: Had been in service with maire Bastien; suffered illness lasting 15 months after dispute with accused at mill; now married in Allemagne

third_parties.name: Jean Pieron
third_parties.context: Convicted of witchcraft 6 years before; had said there was another such household in la Neufville

third_parties.name: Jean Pieron's wife
third_parties.context: Convicted of witchcraft along with husband Jean Pieron

third_parties.name: George de la Roche
third_parties.context: Employer in cloth trade ('marchandise des toiles'); accused was angry and envious because he was taking trade from her husband and son

third_parties.name: late wife of Jean Mourenat
third_parties.context: Suffered continual fever for 9 months after quarrel at mill; cured when accused brought her plate of millet containing healing powder

third_parties.name: Jean Mongeat's wife
third_parties.context: In confession: accused resisted master's incitement to harm her since she was neighbor and friend, but finally consented and master made her ill; accused later repented and gave her healing powder in dish of millet

third_parties.name: Didier Ganar
third_parties.context: His goat died after accused sprinkled powder at edge of field where goats were eating crop (from confession)

third_parties.name: Demenge Ganar
third_parties.context: His horse died after it had done damage outside accused's house; accused killed it with powder (from confession). May be same person as Demenge Guenare or Demenge Ganaire

third_parties.name: Paulans Parmentier
third_parties.context: His cow died after it bumped into accused's cow; killed with powder (from confession)

third_parties.name: Sebille wife of Estienne Pescheur
third_parties.context: Already executed; seen at sabbat in accused's confession

third_parties.name: Fleuratte wife of Bastien des Boenfs
third_parties.context: Seen at sabbat in accused's confession; recognised by her clothing although she had been masked like the others; not yet executed at time of trial

third_parties.name: Mre. Persin
third_parties.context: Devil who seduced accused 15 years before in woods after husband beat her; gave her powder; carried her to sabbat; forced her to commit malefices by threatening to beat her

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a well-documented trial with 26 witnesses providing detailed testimony. Key uncertainties: (1) Witness 9's name is illegible in source. (2) Several people mentioned may be the same person with variant spellings (Demenge Ganar/Demenge Ganaire/Demenge Guenare - likely same person given maire role and accusations). (3) The 'commieres' object mentioned by witness 23 is unclear - context suggests some kind of tool or material used in cloth/textile work near water. (4) Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on: husband was manouvrier (day laborer), accused lacked means to take legal action, confession describes poor being 'put at the bottom' at sabbat, Didier Daulphin (also manouvrier) reduced to poverty and living from alms. (5) Healing practice: accused is described as both harming and healing - confessed to curing Jean Mourenat's wife and Jean Mongeat's wife with plate of milletz containing healing powder, and confessed to receiving both harmful and healing powder from devil. This healing activity coded as 'other' since it doesn't fit standard categories but clearly involves magical healing. (6) Trial costs shared between Duke and abbot of Etival: 118 fr 2 gros. (7) Date discrepancy: document header shows '24 April 1515' but timeline events are clearly 1615 based on internal consistency - this appears to be a transcription error in source.
